translation.text: Eastern Suburbs & Illawarra Line, South Coast Line - Delays

Continue to allow plenty of additional travel time after a fallen tree blocking the track at Como earlier. Please check transport apps or information screens for service updates as some trains may terminate or commence from different locations than timetabled, depart from different platforms or have changed stopping patterns.
Airport & South Line, Bankstown Line - Delays

Some services from the City are delayed, due to a train requiring mechanical repairs at Museum earlier. The issue with the affected train has been rectified. Please allow additional travel time, listen to announcements, check information screens and transport apps, as stopping patterns and departure platforms may change at short notice.
Central Coast & Newcastle Line, Northern Line - Delays

Some services in both directions have been delayed due to signal equipment repairs at Croydon. A frequent service is operating, however your service may depart from a different platform than usual and may have altered stops. Please allow additional travel time, listen to announcements, check information screens and transport apps for service updates.

Please continue to allow additional travel time, due to severe weather conditions affecting rail infrastructure at various locations. There may be a larger-than-usual gap between services at some stations. Please listen to announcements, check information screens and transport apps, as stopping patterns and departure platforms may change at short notice.

NRL: Rabbitohs v Roosters - ANZ Stadium, Sydney Olympic Park
19:55 to 21:40
- Trains run from Lidcombe to Olympic Park every 10 minutes until midnight.

*Limited capacity events - attendees travelling by public transport should allow plenty of additional travel time and plan ahead by checking real-time capacity indicators where available as you may need to wait for the next service with available physical distancing capacity*

Details: https://transportnsw.info/events/2020/09/nrl-rabbitohs-v-roosters

due to severe weather conditions affecting rail infrastructure at Douglas Park. Please allow plenty of additional travel time. Repair crews are on site and working to repair the infrastructure. There is no forecast for when repairs will be completed. More information will be provided as it becomes available.
Due to anti-social behaviour at Central earlier, the last carriage on this service is unavailable. Please spread evenly along the platform, and utilise other carriages.

The lift between the concourse and platform 5 is temporarily out of service. For any assistance, please see station staff or call 9848 9212.
The lift between the concourse and platforms 3/4 is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 9851 7431.
The lift between the concourse and Railway Parade is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or call 9563 7273.
The lift between platform 1 and the concourse is temporarily out of service. For assistance, ask staff or call 4625 2362.

The Suburban Tunnel is temporarily closed for Sydney Metro construction works. Access for Platforms 16 to 23 is only via the Northern Concourse or Southern Tunnel during this period. You can view a map of the station here https://transportnsw.info/document/4930/central-station-map.pdf

There are changes to Platforms 16 and 17 at Central Station due to Sydney Metro construction works. Hoarding for the Central Walk excavation work has moved from the middle of the platform to the southern end of the platform. Temporary concrete ramps connect the existing platform floor surface and the new concrete floor surface areas. For your safety, please move carefully along the platform and follow directions from staff. If you are travelling to Central Station and require assistance to alight from Platforms 16 and 17, please board via the front door of the fourth train carriage.   For more information about the Sydney Metro construction works visit sydneymetro.info.

There are changes to Platforms 22 and 23 at Central Station due to Sydney Metro construction works. Hoarding for the Central Walk excavation work has moved from the middle of the platform to the southern end of the platform. Temporary concrete ramps connect the existing platform floor surface and the new concrete surface areas. For your safety, please move carefully along the platform and follow directions from staff.   For more information about the Sydney Metro construction works visit sydneymetro.info.
Access to and from Como Station from Railway Road will be unavailable from Monday 24 August for approximately 6 weeks. During this time, please enter and exit the station via Como Parade.

From Monday 10th August, station upgrade works will commence and run for a period of approximately 6 weeks. Construction includes the building of new ramps and link bridges. During this time there will be 'stair access only' to/from platform 1. Customers requiring ramp access will be required to make alternative arrangements. For assistance please call Fairy Meadow Station on 02 4223 5582.

Due to station upgrade works installing additional Opal gates, the wide access gate on the Eastern side of the concourse will be temporarily closed from 18 September until 16 October. Please use the new wide access gate available on the Western side of the concourse. Please follow the signs or see Station Staff for assistance.
Power supply issues, caused by severe weather, is affecting station lighting, information screens, lifts and Opal card readers. For Opal information or fare adjustments, visit transportnsw.info/opal.

New Metro Platforms are being constructed on platforms 1 & 2 at Sydenham Station. T3 Bankstown Line services to the City operate from platform 3 & T3 Bankstown Line services to Lidcombe and Liverpool operate from platform 4. Platform 4, 5 & 6 upgrade works - A new Metro concourse is also being constructed at the Northern end of the station. While the concourse is being installed, please board and alight from the first 5 carriages of the train on platforms 4 & 6 and the last 6 carriages of the train on platform 5. If you need help, please see staff at the station. For more information on these upgrades, please see sydneymetro.info
